start.title: Mirewood Town Square
start.description:
The cobblestones glisten under a thin veil of rain, still warm from the day’s heat. Lanterns flicker weakly in wrought-iron sconces, casting long, dancing shadows across the narrow alleys that snake away from the town square. The scent of damp earth and burning tallow fills the air.

You step into the square as the last light bleeds from the sky. A hunched figure closes the shutters of the inn to your left, while the distant clang of metal echoes from the blacksmith’s forge. A stray dog slinks between crates near the boarded-up shopfronts, and above it all, the bell tower looms — silent.

Something feels… off. The town is too quiet for this hour. No chatter. No laughter. Just the uneasy hush of a place holding its breath.
